column1: Biden is currently polling at 42.90%, while Trump is at 43.35%.

The closest states are Florida (5.42% Biden, 94.58% Trump), Nevada (10.10% Biden, 89.90% Trump), Georgia (14.43% Biden, 85.57% Trump), North Carolina (17.17% Biden, 82.83% Trump), Arizona (17.69% Biden, 82.31% Trump), Michigan (29.93% Biden, 70.07% Trump), Pennsylvania (32.90% Biden, 67.10% Trump), Wisconsin (47.19% Biden, 52.81% Trump), Nebraska CD-2 (60.64% Biden, 39.36% Trump), Minnesota (62.82% Biden, 37.18% Trump), New Hampshire (64.49% Biden, 35.51% Trump), Maine (67.12% Biden, 32.88% Trump), Virginia (70.73% Biden, 29.27% Trump), New Mexico (83.69% Biden, 16.31% Trump), Colorado (92.00% Biden, 8.00% Trump), Oregon (94.46% Biden, 5.54% Trump).
Biden has an 29.90% chance of winning the election, Trump has an 69.59% chance of winning the election, and there is an 0.51% chance of a tie.
Biden is expected to win 239 electoral votes, while Trump is expected to win 299 electoral votes.
